column3: In 2012, based on our ongoing OTTI assessments, we determined that the projected cash flows on certain acquired investment securities were less than their initial fair value at acquisition and the difference was therefore recognized in earnings.
We recognized $36 million of OTTI losses in earnings for securities sold during 2010.
Includes undistributed earnings allocated to participating securities using the two-class method under the accounting guidance for computing earnings per share.

Excluded from the computation of diluted earnings per share was 7 million, 30 million and 27 million of awards, options or warrants, during 2012, 2011 and 2010, respectively, because their inclusion would be anti-dilutive.

column2: Consolidated Statements Of Income (USD $) In Millions, except Per Share data, unless otherwise specified
Consolidated Statements Of Income (USD $) In Millions, except Per Share data, unless otherwise specified
Net interest income after provision for credit losses
Service charges and other customer-related fees
Less: Portion of other-than-temporary losses recorded in AOCI
Net other-than-temporary impairment losses recognized in earnings
Income from continuing operations before income taxes
Income from continuing operations, net of tax
Loss from discontinued operations, net of tax
Dividends and undistributed earnings allocated to participating securities
Net income available to common stockholders
Net income per basic common share
Net income per diluted common share

[1]  In 2012, based on our ongoing OTTI assessments, we determined that the projected cash flows on certain acquired investment securities were less than their initial fair value at acquisition and the difference was therefore recognized in earnings.  [2]  We recognized $36 million of OTTI losses in earnings for securities sold during 2010.  [3]  Includes undistributed earnings allocated to participating securities using the two-class method under the accounting guidance for computing earnings per share.  [4]  Excluded from the computation of diluted earnings per share was 7 million, 30 million and 27 million of awards, options or warrants, during 2012, 2011 and 2010, respectively, because their inclusion would be anti-dilutive.
